The CEO signed a secret contract, but used a dangerously small exponent. Can you recover the original message from this weak RSA signature? Ciphertext: 0x93f0e997d202a5161d11cb6a0e2502b17027c17b7cde698a27607273b8ac90cb97d2b2f17be15306dc7bbf6c9772b4ed509b73cf8d53d7017e3db1a6ac8109af

Public Key (n, e): (11970194214790388281169504273008912191181295859653814539566045949085297478077588575670332419291520781824313933837209293770343191918830817184980579973748689, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{l2docm38}
ciphertext: 0x93f0e997d202a5161d11cb6a0e2502b17027c17b7cde698a27607273b8ac90cb97d2b2f17be15306dc7bbf6c9772b4ed509b73cf8d53d7017e3db1a6ac8109af
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (11970194214790388281169504273008912191181295859653814539566045949085297478077588575670332419291520781824313933837209293770343191918830817184980579973748689, 3)

archetype: signature_schemes
